experiences if you search the discussions.
Mara

messages.msgSnippet: Thanks so much for that bit of help. She still has a bit of milk from a birthed baby, so that should help her out a bit. The baby is yet born, so she needs to
messages.messageBody:
Thanks so much for that bit of help. She still has a bit of milk from a
birthed baby, so that should help her out a bit. The baby is yet born, so she
needs to get on it then :) Thanks so much!

Love,
Karen

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] OT: Adoptive Breastfeeding
messages.msgSnippet: When i was 18 i gave a baby up for adoption, his mom BFed him for  nearly 20 months.  It took her 6 months to get her milk in, it was easier  for her then for
messages.messageBody:
When i was 18 i gave a baby up for adoption, his mom BFed him for nearly 20
months. It took her 6 months to get her milk in, it was easier for her then
for some because she had, had a baby when she was 19 so she had previously
lactated. She used a drug (i dont remember the exact name i know it was a nose
spray) that the side effect was lactation, then she pumped and pumped and
pumped for 6 months till she finally started producing enough to actually BF.
It isnt an easy process and it is not 100% that she will lactate but it's
worth a try.
